website_summaries.verdict: A unique alternative to traditional models, but it has some issues. The word combination feature strongly appeals to some consumers.
pros: Uses words instead of numbers, which some users prefer
Letters are large and easy to read
Combination is easy to change, and instructions are clear
cons: The design is somewhat bulky and heavy
Some owners have received faulty locks that fell apart

customer_reviews.title: Lock jams too easily
customer_reviews.text: This 4 letter combo lock is a great idea. It's pretty easy to set up and use. However, after 5 months of alternate daily use at a middle school, the lock jammed open and would not budge. There is apparently a design flaw inside the lock that allows it to easily get jammed after it's been opened. I used pliers to force it out of its jammed position after spraying silicone lubricant inside the lock. This particular incident doesn't leave me with a whole lot of confidence in the lock. And Master's 2-4 week replacement timeframe for warranty replacements is totally unacceptable.
customer_reviews.author: W. S. Mason

customer_reviews.title: sticky tumblers caused incorrect password entry.  Had to throw it away, sadly.
customer_reviews.text: Altho I have two other resettable word locks (another brand) this one was hard to turn, and the word got messed up during the set up. The lock locked and was not resettable, but not to the word I chose. Obviously some user error, altho I do indeed know how to do this, but it was the stickiness of the turning tumblers that caused the wrong word to enter. I was unable to work out which letter it might have been. After trying all the variables I could think of, I threw it away, since it was unusable in the locked position. Plus, it was a very heavy lock compared to my two other ones. Overall, not a good experience.
customer_reviews.author: LooksBooks

customer_reviews.title: Even the most incompetent person could pick this thing
customer_reviews.text: I just bought this and out of the package I can tell it isn't any good. First it opened on "loct", "Locd" and "lock" when it should only open on "Lock" . I am the sort of person who is always messing up number combination locks and getting locked out. I have no lock picking skills what so ever. I picked this lock just by feeling it as it turned. I think it would actually be safer to leave your gym locker unlocked and hope no one bothers your stuff rather than having this thing draw attention to it.
customer_reviews.author: AzBookLover

customer_reviews.title: American company producing products like a chinese company.
customer_reviews.text: I had used it 3 times before it exploded in pieces on me. I had locked, spun the combo dial around, and just let it go and it banged against the gym locker and it just exploded into pieces. People looked at me. I just picked up the pieces amd grab my stuff and went home. Very embarrassed and disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Power AMZN User

customer_reviews.title: My daughter asked for this lock for her new middle ...
customer_reviews.text: My daughter asked for this lock for her new middle school locker. It worked for 1 (ONE) week and fell apart. Literally, she whet to open her locker this morning and it came falling in her hands.
customer_reviews.author: Anna A.

customer_reviews.title: The lock is fairly large and the code easily discovered if using in an active surrounding
customer_reviews.text: Unlike many locks that can be re- locked even if not on the secret 'code', this must be on secret code to lock AND unlock. Which means it has to stay on secret code and not scrambled while getting into locked item or scrambling immediately after unlocking, entering code to lock, lock and then scramble again. If you are looking for something covert this isn't it. The lock is fairly large and the code easily discovered if using in an active surrounding. BUT, the lock is made well and is easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: PSWolcott

customer_reviews.title: They come in red only!
customer_reviews.text: The locks themselves are great. The false advertising when they imply it will be blue, yet comes red, is not very honest, and pretty lazy to not include that information somewhere, maybe where choosing a size or within the product description or—ahem—the dominant photo of the product. Color is not worth the resources wasted to return it but I can’t help but feel disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: Dav

customer_reviews.title: Very BAD lock.
customer_reviews.text: Horrible product. Advertised as outdoor lock, I used this for less than 90 days on an outdoor locker and totally rusted and decayed. See picture. Do not buy this.
customer_reviews.author: DC Dweller

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the Gym Locker
customer_reviews.text: The instructions & procedure for customizing the combo is super easy to understand. It appears the letters will not rub off over time. Not all letters in the alphabet are available, so you'll have to be flexible and patient selecting a combo word. The con: It totally sucks that you can't pick the color. My son is not thrilled that his gym locker - lock is pink. Why can't you request the color you want. Stay away from vendor who do not give you control of the color. I should return it.
customer_reviews.author: Tribulation ExodusTop Contributor: Baking

customer_reviews.title: Got a dud
customer_reviews.text: Lock is sturdy, but really heavy and bulky. In spite of the bulky size I was still was looking forward to being able to remember a word more easily than a number code. Set my lock code and used it a few times with no issue, then after about three lock/unlock times it just stopped unlocking and is now stuck shut no matter how much I play with the dials. Bummer.
customer_reviews.author: aonewomanriot

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Remember
customer_reviews.text: This is a good quality lock. I like it because it's so easy to remember a word rather than a combination. I only wish you could pick the color. I ended up with dark blue which is fine but not what I would've picked. You are only able to lock the lock when you have your password put in. This means you have to hide your combination when you have it off your locker. Other than that I really like it and hopefully I'll never again forget my combination!
customer_reviews.author: Megan Stepanek

customer_reviews.title: It was great until...
customer_reviews.text: My son uses this lock for his locker at school. Yesterday the lock locked without the latch being closed, so we are now unable to insert the latch and lining up the letters to the correct code doesn't unlock it or allow the latch to be inserted. How does this happen?! Extremely disappointed. only 2 months of use.
customer_reviews.author: BrooklynBronxBeautii

customer_reviews.title: Basic, inexpensive, easy to set
customer_reviews.text: Looking at the reviews, people who were not happy were commonly buying for middle schoolers who would need to access several times a day and were possibly rough with the locks. I use these locks on a crawlspace and 2 cabinets that I want to keep inaccessible to renters and I only access it once ro twice a month at most. Also, I love not having to worry about misplacing the key,, or having husband or housekeeper misplace key. So for light use, it is attractive, economical, easy to use, easy to set. I would not recommend for outdoor use or where someone could use a bolt cutter. But for my purposes discussed above, perfect.
customer_reviews.author: nekko925

customer_reviews.title: Locked Out!!!Junk!!
customer_reviews.text: I hope my struggle with this lock will save some out else. Do NOT buy this pile of "nice looking" JUNK! I purely bought it because it looked good but aesthetics bit me in the behind because after 6 or 7 uses, It locked me out and I could not get it to open for the life of me... I had to get the shackle cut open to be able to get my stuff out of the locker. Life lesson, no more master lock brand for me...
customer_reviews.author: Pedro Rodriguez Rizo

customer_reviews.title: Hard to use
customer_reviews.text: I really dislike this lock and am throwing it out. First, while you can set your own combination, you don't have access to the whole alphabet for each of the four letters in the combination, so you have to think of a word that uses the available letters. This is a nuisance. More importantly, I find it difficult to turn the four wheels to the correct combination. Perhaps I am all thumbs? but for example while turning the wheel for the third letter I will often accidentally turn the wheel for the second letter as well, undoing the correct positioning.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: BIG easy to see letters
customer_reviews.text: This is a fantastic lock for us. We have several Master Locks for boats and beach toys with 4 digit programable codes but we're using this one for the chainlink fence to reach the beach area where plenty of people can have access that we don't want to give the 4 digit code to. It's not as hardy as the ones we use for the boat but it's big easy to see letters and easy to spin tumblers are perfect for the application (and folks could jump the gate, this just keeps honest folks honest and inconvienences the others).
customer_reviews.author: Christopher

customer_reviews.title: Well Made but Vulnerable to Snoops
customer_reviews.text: Very well made. Easy to set combo and operate. Only downside is that a snoop could easily read your combination word as you unlock it. Plus, it seems that kids can't resist telling their friends which combo word they chose. My daughter uses it for her basketball locker and couldn't resist telling her friend that her combo was "dunk." Her friend's combo was "ball."
customer_reviews.author: Kajoe T Dapa

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I’m not understanding all the bad reviews...this lock is genius! I’ve run out of adult brain space for more passwords/PIN numbers/number combinations, all you have to do is remember your selected 4 letter word! I’m sure if one really wanted to they could google/YouTube how to reset the word and break in, but one could also carry around a GD hacksaw and cut any lock off that they wanted to. For my purpose of using it in the women’s locker room at the gym, this lock is absolutely perfect.
customer_reviews.author: clogan

customer_reviews.title: I can unlock it without glasses
customer_reviews.text: I just got this, and was able to set a new password fairly easily without glasses. That was the reason for this purchase, I will use it at the pool and my glasses will be inside the locker., I was having trouble reading the numbers on the previous lock. The rotation was a bit stiff at first but loosened up quickly. I did not use a word, I used the first letter on 4 words that are easy to recall.
customer_reviews.author: Mizbet

customer_reviews.title: Wishing I had continued looking a bit more
customer_reviews.text: This is significantly heavier than I had expected- and although the letters are easy to read, turning the dials isn’t quite as smooth as I had hoped - in that once you get a letter in place it moves a bit while getting the next one to come up. Also was a bit bummed that I didn’t get the choice of color- The other thing that I hadn’t considered before purchasing is that this lock is round and somewhat bulky and awkward. I wish now I had found something a bit less bulky for the glum and work.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Really good quality lock.
customer_reviews.text: A decently heavy lock with the added bonus of fun colors and easy to remember alphabetic codes. We use it to lock up our side gate with our trash cans behind it. I know that a heavy set of bolt cutters will cut the lock because I had to do it when the neighbor kid accidentally reset the code... so probably not your number one choice for security, but good enough to deter surface snooping, and convenient/good enough for us to buy twice. I know it's not rated for outside use but it really stood up to weathering in our climate (AZ) for the 6+ years we had it before having to replace it.
customer_reviews.author: MThings

customer_reviews.title: BEWARE:  You Might Get PINK
customer_reviews.text: I like this lock, although it hasn't gotten much use. One thing to be aware of is that since you don't get a choice of colors, you might get one that appears pink. I purchased this for my middle school aged son for his gym locker. Well, when it arrived, the color appears pink (I think it's really supposed to be red, but with the way the plastic is, it has a bit of a magenta appearance). So, this was a NO-GO for us. I'll keep it around for my use, but I wish there was a way to choose the color, because it seems like a decent lock, and I like that you can make a word the combo.
customer_reviews.author: chicagoliz

customer_reviews.title: Works great.  Easy to program.  Durable!
customer_reviews.text: We use these in our escape room. They are easy to program. The wheels have large letters that are easy to see and easy to move. We purchased other brand locks, and they all failed within a month. These see to be durable. We haven't had a single failure We've replaced all our other 4 letter locks with these. Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.author: Summitgeorge

customer_reviews.title: The coconut smell is strong and lasting
customer_reviews.text: I have loved this product since the 1970's living in Boulder CO. I now live on the East Coast and came across Skin Trip at Whole Foods one day, blast from the past. So instead of paying their price, I ordered on Amazon, got 2 bottles quickly and have been using it daily and loving it. I have tried to replicate this lotion over the years, nothing comes close. Skin Trip rocks!
customer_reviews.author: Chrissy

customer_reviews.title: locked up!
customer_reviews.text: i bought this for the gym so i didnt have to remember a number combo or carry around a key. the spin phrase is a little tricky... like i have pretty broad fingers (for a lady) aka man hands, and the other day i needed to get out my inhaler cause i was in major need and had some trouble lining up the word. if your fingers are normal lady size, then this is the lock for you. also note, there is a limit on the words you can make, like if you want anything cat, like 'meow' or 'cats' you are out of luck. haha.
customer_reviews.author: Kat Facepunch

customer_reviews.title: Great Idea and Easy with no Glasses
customer_reviews.text: What a great idea to have a lock that is letters instead of numbers. It's super easy to remember the combo and would be very unlikely that anyone would guess the exact word unless you used your name or something like that. The main reason I even purchased a new lock though is because I kept forgetting to bring my glasses when I went to my storage room and couldn't read the tiny numbers on the lock without them. These letters are large enough to see so I don't need my glasses. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: David Armstrong

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this lock for a gym locker, no more looking for my locker. This lock is so easy to use any 4 letter combination will do. Easy to change the combination when you want. I gave it a 4 star because it is just a tad bit on the heavy side,however, i am using this as a gym locker and I can deal with that. I like the fact that I do not have to rotate the combination several different ways to open it. In my opinion I would purchase this Master Lock again.
customer_reviews.author: BMG

customer_reviews.title: A little hard to turn
customer_reviews.text: Bought two of these for an escape room at our library so we had one in action and an extra in case that one stopped working. We never needed to use the second one. These lock well and are easy to set to your own code. The only downsides are that the wheels are a little hard to turn (not overly difficult, just a little crowded) and that you need to make sure the lock is on the correct combination in order to lock it...learned that the hard way! I would recommend these.
customer_reviews.author: dreamyraynbo

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Padlock. Accident Proof Combination Procedure.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent padlock, setting the combination is easy and accident proof. At the bottom, there's a small slot which needs to be rotated with a coin or flat head screwdriver, once in position, set the combination, rotate back to its original position and voila, it's done. There's 0 chance of accidentally changing the combination. The numbers are big and easy to turn. Good quality overall.
customer_reviews.author: Freakonforfatty

customer_reviews.title: A superior lock.
customer_reviews.text: I love that it is made up of letters, and so it is easy to create a 4 letter word to remember. This makes it effortless to open anything it is keeping locked. I used to forget the numbers on my padlock, and twice have had to ask the health club to cut if off my locker. Embarrassing. With this design, that is no longer necessary. What a relief!
customer_reviews.author: charlene temple

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use and much easier to remember than a number combination. It does have a limited amount of letter combinations. It stands out from other locks at the gym too, so I don't have to worry too much about remembering my locker number. I highly recommend setting your own combination since the default is LOCK, but the instructions are very clear and easy to follow.
customer_reviews.author: Rachel

customer_reviews.title: Cheap but good
customer_reviews.text: Numbers are easy to turn but cumbersome to turn the next row without moving the ones above or below unless you have tiny fingers. Works as intended, easy directions to reset!
customer_reviews.author: Fern_Gully

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use lock
customer_reviews.text: I bought this lock to use on the lockers at the gym. I don't like the standard spinning combo locks for multiple reasons plus they remind me of high school. With this lock, I can pick a four letter word (there are lots of fun ones) set it and never have to worry about forgetting a series of random numbers. The dials spin smoothly and the letters are large enough that you don't have to squint to see them. Easy to open and close. A real winner for an indoor lock. My only problem was that I didn't get to pick the color. I would have been okay with any color but pink, and of course that's what I got.
customer_reviews.author: Big Todd

customer_reviews.title: So far no issues, easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Really, no issues for me. I like that it is easy to customize the passcode so I can recall over time. I own multiple of this product, and one of mine does “stick” at times but a little bit of twisting back and forth can’t “unstick” and get the lock to open. Nothing that’s a deal breaker. As far as assorted colors go, you really don’t know what color you’ll get from the seller. I’ve purchased the single pack two separate times and have gotten magenta and teal.
customer_reviews.author: Calimari

customer_reviews.title: Ehhhhhh........
customer_reviews.text: So for the price it’s a lock. To lock it has to be on the “word”, can’t just randomly push it closed to lock. Also there is a “gate” on the lock that only allows you to lock by swinging into one position from one direction. Make sense so you don’t lock it backwards but is a hassle. Also bought used from amazon and there were no instructions, the lock was locked and the combo was not provided.
customer_reviews.author: David

customer_reviews.title: Cumbersome
customer_reviews.text: The lock code has to be set to lock the lock. It is cumbersome to have to set the lock to lock and unlock. Most locks lock on any combination, but this one only locks when the code is set. It’s very picky about letters being in line also. Just not a fan of how thick the lock is either. It gets the job done, but isn’t the best it could be.
customer_reviews.author: Melodyp75

customer_reviews.title: Works well
customer_reviews.text: Overall it works exactly like you'd expect a lock to. My only qualm is that some of the letters are flat making them very difficult to move independently. I usually end up just spinning the top two letters and leaving the bottom two in set on my passcode.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren S.

customer_reviews.title: Very easy to set up
customer_reviews.text: One of the biggest concerns I had for my preteen going to school this year was the use of a locker. I can't even count the number of nightmare situations I had when I was in school because I could never remember my locker combination. This lock solved all of those problems! It is very easy to set up you get to choose the word that you want.
customer_reviews.author: amy stringfellow

customer_reviews.title: Very sturdy and heavy.
customer_reviews.text: This lock is sturdy, yet bit heavy. You have to have your 'word' visible in order to close it which makes it easy for someone to see your code. It's kinda stiff turning the letters and they move while you are trying to finish your code word. I'm old and crotchety with arthritis in my fingers so I found it hard to use. Someone who doesn't have my issues will probably love it!
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Large lock
customer_reviews.text: it is bigger than I thought it was going to be. The letters are not easy to turn. It is also heavier than I thought. Also it was not easy to find a word to make as the combo. It works, glad I got it so I don't have to remember a # as I have lost several locks at the gym and couldn't keep the combinations straight. But I wish it was a bit easier to use.
customer_reviews.author: Val Findlay

customer_reviews.title: Excellent for homemade escape rooms
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for a portion of the escape room puzzle I made for friends. I don't know why I expected to be able to make any four-letter word, but after I bought it I realized that my choice of actual words would be a little limited. The lock does come with a myriad of 4 letter words you could use as a suggestion, or you could just make up any 4 letter combination you'd like. I ended using the word "DIED" which I think was fitting for my escape room theme.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Chen

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful colors and letter combination
customer_reviews.text: I bought the lock because I liked the colors. I was very pleasantly surprised when I received it and it has letters as the combination. That makes life so much easier! One thing to keep in mind it doesn’t have the entire alphabet so it’s possible the four letter word you’re thinking of using might not be possible.
customer_reviews.author: MiamiLadyLiving

customer_reviews.title: Just weird!!
customer_reviews.text: 1) in the picture it’s blue, but what I received is pink. As a guy, not thrilled about using a pink lock! 2) the way the letters turn makes it a little tricky to turn 1 dial at a time. 3) whatever code you choose must be lined up to relock it. You’ll slide the lock together, then twist the letters to not be your combo. It’s odd, and you almost have to use 2 hands to do it. THE CHEF DOES NOT RECOMMEND!!
customer_reviews.author: Jermany

customer_reviews.title: Quick to use.
customer_reviews.text: This is so much easier and quicker to open and close than those standard combination style locks. It is also more secure as I can't 'bump' open it. The shape is great for using on gym lockers. Has a good weighted feel to it. Well worth the extra couple of bucks over the cheap combination dial style.
customer_reviews.author: Ted

customer_reviews.title: Does the Job In 4 Letters!
customer_reviews.text: These are great locks. When you are at the gym and you don't want to lug around your wallet/keys/coat, you can just pop your stuff into a locker and use this lock. Pick 4 letters or a word you will remember and voila! Lock your items up. Easy to set your code, sturdy, strong, and a good price. People who leave their things unlocked at the gym are just asking for a thief to take advantage of them. Get a good lock. Get this lock!
customer_reviews.author: B. Rubin

customer_reviews.title: Can be tricky
customer_reviews.text: This lock is a little tricky. I have a couple of them on storage units that my staff use and invariably someone doesn't click the shackle back into the body well enough and they leave it like that. With the "lip" type part that comes up to cover both ends of the shackle it's often difficult to see if it's completely inserted. If it were just for me I'd say it's an okay lock but having others who aren't as careful using it I won't buy this lock again.
customer_reviews.author: Cynthia B.

customer_reviews.title: Cute
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set up, and fairly easy to use, the dials can be a little bit of a pain to move, but it is working out great as my at work locker lock :D Just be aware if you have funny coworkers they will spell out all the 4 letter words they can think of and leave it on there for you to see. Make sure you don't use a naughty 4 letter word as the code or they will get it right away.
customer_reviews.author: A. Solomon

customer_reviews.title: A great lock by Master Lock - love using a word combo!
customer_reviews.text: Great lock for gym locker. Easy to set your own 4 letter word (haha no not those kind of 4 letter words - I suggest being more creative otherwise you’re greatly increasing your odds of having some loser come along and try to use the few words in their limited vocabulary and - tada - they will successfully open the lock) It’s a great lock all around and I’ve had no problems with mine. I highly recommend this lock and all locks made by Master Lock.
customer_reviews.author: SoCal_vs_Midwest

customer_reviews.title: Simply amazing! Buy it!!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing. Simply amazing in every way. Quality is unquestionably great, had doubts, but were immediately erased when we played with it for a while. Can think of extremely creative combinations, and really easy to set. This is the best lock, guaranteed. Sturdy, easy, and fail proof in every way. I recommend it extremely!
customer_reviews.author: Helen Yu

customer_reviews.title: Not good for people with big hands.
customer_reviews.text: The metal loop is extremely short and the numbers are tough to twist. If you have big hands, good luck trying to turn the numbers. It's even harder when you are trying to cover the numbers to prevent people from looking at your combination! Cons: Tough to twist numbers Short metal lock loop Feel like it's made of cheap material
customer_reviews.author: Dard Y.

customer_reviews.title: I like the overall feature!
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would get turquoise but I like the pink one as well. There's as much letter combination that I would like to make it with 4 letters. Other than the limited letter combinations, I like it. I don't see any issue with structure and it is really easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: Hannah

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use - even for those who have problems seeing up close
customer_reviews.text: These locks fix a problem that I never realized existed...until now. As you get older and you go to a gym with 'do it yourself' locker locks and use a normal combination lock then you can't actually open the locker because your reading glasses are INSIDE the locker. The large type and high contrast of the letters on this lock solves this issue. Also, by raising every other letter the lock gives extra help if legibility is still a problem.
customer_reviews.author: ljmiii

customer_reviews.title: Absoluetly Perfect!
customer_reviews.text: Just love the aspects of a combination lock with memory instead of a key I do the Gym every other day and need to lock up my stuff at the Gym No problem with the worry of losing the key as the combination is set Good workmanship Certainly buy this one next time I need another lock
customer_reviews.author: Metal Trader

customer_reviews.title: Easy Lock
customer_reviews.text: Easy to set and easy to use. I would give it 5 stars, but the whit paint chips off easily. That is pretty minor. My 11 years uses this at school pretty easily. She is able to get in and out of her lock pretty quickly. I wish you could choose your color when ordering.
customer_reviews.author: Mommy

customer_reviews.title: Fun new way to lock up your belongings.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my gym locker. I find it much more fun to write a funny word than trying to remember some number combo. I do find myself looking over my shoulder when trying to write the word, for fear someone will watch. The lock won't close unless it is on the word you have selected, so I have to make sure it stays to that when not using it for convenience sake.
customer_reviews.author: Killian Derusha

customer_reviews.title: Misleading. Not a pack, just one good lock
customer_reviews.text: Don’t be fooled it says “pack” but it is just one lock. Very misleading. But... it is very easy to use and reset to the password of your choice. Just remember the password because if you can’t get it after it’s reset you will not be able to use it. Sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: YupYups

customer_reviews.title: Lock works great but is rusting (aesthetically) after 1 month use outdoors
customer_reviews.text: Lock works great but is showing evidence of rust after 1 month use outdoors. Fortunately, the rust is not on the steel so it doesn't seem to compromise the locking, but it does change the look. We have also had some rough thunderstorms lately.
customer_reviews.author: Michael J.

customer_reviews.title: Very useful, Very good
customer_reviews.text: It can rearrange your lock password as you wish. The lock has good quality, and design is good. I use as my Gym locker lock. Since I changed the password, I will never forget it. And it can be reset easily. I really like it and maybe order again for my wife locker.
customer_reviews.author: Aung More

customer_reviews.title: Does the job and fairly easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: Simple instructions. I had to tell my teen the combination once and it was easy to remember how to change it afterward without having to give up use of the lock because I couldn’t find the instructions. The tumblers are a little tricky to turn with my sausage fingers but that’s on me.
customer_reviews.author: Hoppermomma

customer_reviews.title: Cute but not best security
customer_reviews.text: Looks great. Just what a 10 year old would want. The letters are easy to use BUT, so is it easy for others to see. When you unlock it, they leave it where it is and it’s visible for others to see. My daughters locker was broken into that way. Numbers are better, not as easy to see or memorize like words.
customer_reviews.author: Jennifer

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't open even by a lock picker
customer_reviews.text: I have a friend who used to be a locksmith so whenever I lose my keys, he opens things for me. I asked him if he could open combo locks and he said he could. I handed him this one and no matter how he tried, he couldn't open it. It's heavy and very strong. My new fave lock.
customer_reviews.author: pixie nolin

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy!
customer_reviews.text: This is my second lettered lock - the only reason it's my second is I lost my first. I love the idea of a word because let's face, we all have numbers swirling in our heads and I felt more confident that I'd remember a word. Very easy to set up and use. I would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon customer

customer_reviews.title: Ok, but small, and the a different color.
customer_reviews.text: It's relatively small, but seems to work well, and shoed up pink instead of blue. I have had several other Master Word Combination locks that were great at first, but either broke or the dials corroded and became unreadable within a few weeks being used outside. Bought this one because I am assuming the plastic dials won't corrode...
customer_reviews.author: Stephanie

customer_reviews.title: Nice lock
customer_reviews.text: Nice lock but the part that locks into the lock itself can only go one direction to allow the lock to click into itself. I got it for the gym and don’t know how many times I’ve had to take it off the locker because of that. But it’s easy to spin around and since I don’t have to worry about a key that makes it even more desirable.
customer_reviews.author: HParker

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to crack
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to crack. Got this lock 3 weeks ago, changed the word and never used until now and I couldn’t remember the combination. Went to youtube for a video on how to open it and it took me less than a minute to find the combination. Too bad I don’t have the package anymore or I would return this.
customer_reviews.author: Martha H Castellanos

customer_reviews.title: Made with true Master Lock design and quality
customer_reviews.text: This lock is a very sturdy, yet small pad lock that will fill the needs of securing smaller lockers, bikes, and tool boxes. The 4 LETTER tumbler system is easier to remember than numbers. (at least for me). A very good product from Master Lock.
customer_reviews.author: Gary C.

customer_reviews.title: Fell Apart
customer_reviews.text: This started off great. It was easy to use for my 13 year old son. He used it everyday on his P.E. Locker. One day he came home and it was in pieces Mx it completely broke apart. Not worth the hassle, I wouldn’t recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Jordan W.

customer_reviews.title: Cute lock but was vandalized/broken easily.
customer_reviews.text: Nice lock but was easily broken. Got this for my high school kid. However some other kids broke it one day when vandalizing some of the locks in the locker room. So now I need a new one but will seek a stronger lock.
customer_reviews.author: Jenny

customer_reviews.title: broke after using only a few times
customer_reviews.text: Used this lock at the gym a handful of times at the gym. Dropped it unlocking my locker and it fell about 18 inches and now it no longer works. It unlocked but isn't possible to close the lock anymore. A short drop like that shouldn't break a lock. I would steer clear of this and buy something different.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Oates

customer_reviews.title: because the functionality is nice. Measure before buying
customer_reviews.text: The size of this lock is too tall to fit into a standard locker. I tried in a few at different exercise studios with different types of lockers... the lock simply can't be used. Unfortunate, because the functionality is nice. Measure before buying.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Consider size more than I did...
customer_reviews.text: This was really cool and worked. Unfortunately i couldnt use it because it didnt fit my gym locker like i thought it would. A word to others, do actually look at your gym locker handles.. maybe they dont have as much room for jimmying in a lock as you think! 5 stars still a great item
customer_reviews.author: kikila3

customer_reviews.title: Never Forget Your Combination!
customer_reviews.text: I've had number combinations over the years, and over time I forget the code! Spelling out a 4 letter word is much easier to memorize so this lock makes it so easy. I use it when I go to the gym and use a locker to keep my items safe. I've never had any problems with this lock. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Typelovely

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use lock
customer_reviews.text: I wish I would’ve purchased this years ago. It’s so much easier to remember a word for the combination instead of a number. I use it all the time at the gym. It works great and is easy to program, lock and unlock.
customer_reviews.author: SLF

customer_reviews.title: Great lock.
customer_reviews.text: This lock is super easy to use and works great on my locker at work. It is only getting a 4star however because they just send you whatever color they want. I thought I was ordering a blue, and ended up with a pink.
customer_reviews.author: Katie

customer_reviews.title: Saved me the stress of racking my brain remembering numbered combinations.
customer_reviews.text: I really like these letter locks. I have bought 3 of them over the last year. For the life of my I could not remember any of the number combination locks that I had as I would get them confused for all the other numbered combinations that I need to remember. This really fixed that for me and I like to spell out different words on the lock as my combinations which is fun.
customer_reviews.author: arrum

customer_reviews.title: So much easier to remember a word than random numbers
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use. I ended up buying 3 of these locks and they all work great! Love that I don't have to remember numbers, or to bring a key. I would put 5 stars but only putting 4 because it seems you can't easily choose a color on amazon (when buying one, at least), and I really wanted my 3 locks to be different colors. Other than that, love these locks!
customer_reviews.author: Alicia D.

customer_reviews.title: My password is not BUTT.  Nope.  I'm an adult.
customer_reviews.text: Sadly this does not fit in some lockers. It's big and it's heavy. However, when it does fit it works quite well. This is easier for me to remember than a score of numbers. If I am not using a lock often enough, then I am not going to remember the numbers. This does the trick. And if you are totally a 13 year old at heart and want to have ridiculous words or swears as your password then this will fit the need.
customer_reviews.author: Srae

customer_reviews.title: Not exactly as expected but close enough and would buy again
customer_reviews.text: Nice lock. We must not have read the description closely enough. We thought the piece with the letters for the password would be blue but when we got it the piece that shows blue in the picture was black. Not a big deal though. Still a nice padlock.
customer_reviews.author: Laura Cannon

customer_reviews.title: bulky but convenient
customer_reviews.text: I got this because I'm terrible at remembering the numbers on a combo lock. It works well enough but after a good workout, with my big sweaty fingers, it can be tough to maneuver the individual letters into place.
customer_reviews.author: TH

customer_reviews.title: Perfect Gym Lock
customer_reviews.text: I will NEVER use a number combination lock again. The confusion on whether you are turning it the right amount of times in the correct direction gets old. I've been using this lock for years without any issues and I love the ridiculous words I can choose to unlock it.
customer_reviews.author: AnnMarie Green

customer_reviews.title: Product is as advertised
customer_reviews.text: Got two for granddaughter for middle school. The fact that there are no numbers involved, only a 4 letter code she can set herself and actually remember. was best idea ever. She's happy with them, so I'm happy
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Why aren’t all locks like this??
customer_reviews.text: My daughter could never remember her combinations. Has had more than one lock cut off because of it. Letters instead of numbers? Brilliant! And if she forgets her brother’s name, I give up.
customer_reviews.author: K.Stacey

customer_reviews.title: Do you just get a random color?
customer_reviews.text: So love the lock. So easy to set your own code. My only problem is I bought it for the ease instead of the turning searching for numbers, but also the color. Almost every picture in this page for this lock showed a tealish blue. Mine was red. Random. I went back to see and yup blue. There isn’t even an option to pick any other color.
customer_reviews.author: Alison

customer_reviews.title: It’s a lock that locks
customer_reviews.text: Good in theory but the letters are difficult to turn one row at a time so it’s harder to unlock this one. It works to keep my locker at the gym secure so it serves its purpose very well.
customer_reviews.author: Lori D

customer_reviews.title: Just BAD
customer_reviews.text: This lock is BAD! Do not waste your money on it! My son set his combo and now cannot open it. I literally just received this lock TODAY and cannot use it now. I should have read further down on the reviews that state others have had this same problem. Buy a traditional combination lock and save yourself the frustration!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: Followed instructions to set up password. Worked once now it won't open again and I can't reset it. Can't find an option to contact seller for help. Not worth returning it. I live in Canada so I shipped it to my US mailbox. Just lost $7 US
customer_reviews.author: diamond miner

customer_reviews.title: Great for kids with learning disabilities
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this product for my son as he is entering middle school next year and needs this for his PE locker. He has specific learning disabilities and this is much easier for him to remember the word combination versus a number combination. He loves it!
customer_reviews.author: Shannon

customer_reviews.title: Very robust lock and easy to use and change
customer_reviews.text: This lock is very easy to use and is heavy-duty. It was very easy to set my own word. You do have to make sure the letters are lined up exactly but I see that as more of a benefit than a nuisance since it makes it more secure.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas P

customer_reviews.title: I did not like that I could not choose the color
customer_reviews.text: Each disk has only 10 letters to choose from. So you cannot make it anything you want. Lightweight and solid. Alternating letters are raised for ease of turning (you can tell in the photo once you realize it). I did not like that I could not choose the color. Made of cast metal that looks like plastic. My particular lock had a spot of paint missing right out of the box. Don't know if this is typical but this will probably happen with use anyway.
customer_reviews.author: D. Cox

customer_reviews.title: Lock is great butt has one security flaw
customer_reviews.text: I love this lock! It is easy to use, easy to change, and allows for easy to remember combinations. The problem is, I am very immature... So are most people. Both times I have set a code on the lock someone was able to guess it. BOOB and POOP are easy guessed passwords.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron

customer_reviews.title: Nice Quality - Good Enough For a Gym Locker
customer_reviews.text: This locks works just as advertised. Of all of the vertical locks, this seems to have the tightest tolerances without being stubborn. It seems a little more shim-resistant than a few of the other brands I see on store shelves. It only offers a few seconds of resistance to a dedicated lock picker, or a sledge hammer, so I wouldn't suggest this on any exterior lock or to protect anything too valuable. But, if you want to keep clowns out of your gym locker, this lock is fine.
customer_reviews.author: Mr. Staack

customer_reviews.title: Love these locks
customer_reviews.text: Easy to use, easy to set the combo, easy to remember the combo.
customer_reviews.author: D. Inman

customer_reviews.title: Quality manifacturer
customer_reviews.text: The movers placed my possessions in the strangest of boxes. I needed a lock for my storage unit ASAP. I have always trusted Master Lock so I naturally got another one. I found my old one in a box labeled "master bath"
customer_reviews.author: Cathy C.

customer_reviews.title: Limited word choices
customer_reviews.text: Used for a DIY escape room. Was disappointed in the lack of letters in each row. Was hoping to have a wider range, but after modifying the puzzle a bit, it did the job perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Brenda

customer_reviews.title: Hard to close for my son in gym and got stollen
customer_reviews.text: Thought this would be great for my son that has memory issues but he had trouble keeping it closed/locked, Wednesday closed and ended up getting stolen When it opened on him on gym locker. Great concept but wasn’t good for my son .
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Easy to use and does the job!
customer_reviews.text: Love the ease of setting the code as well as using this lock. If you’re tired of having to remember numbers and the whole right/left stuff then this is the lock for you.
customer_reviews.author: Bizzymammabee

customer_reviews.title: Easy to read combo
customer_reviews.text: Great lock for gym. Easy to read, big letters. Set your own combo . I got letters and spell a 4 letter word for combo. Different from everyone else. Easy to see your locker. I got this because I was having trouble seeing standard combo lock. Fixed the problem. Robust lock.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Works at first, then fails
customer_reviews.text: Junk...worked for about 4 weeks (bought it for gym, used it 3-4 times per week, so maybe 15 times total). Easy to set your own combination, but it WILL change/slip/fail on its own. Really annoying, had to have it cut off my locker to get to my stuff and it was about a week past Amazon's return date, so no recourse. Not worth the hassle if you lock your stuff up and can't get back to it.
customer_reviews.author: Tighe Walker

customer_reviews.title: Best lock ever!!
customer_reviews.text: This was our 3rd attempt with a locker lock. We lost 2 sets of keys, and couldn't remember a regular combination. I discovered this and it was an answer to prayer!!! The lock is cute, easy to use, easy to reconfigure another code!! It also makes searching for your locker easy. We love it!!!
customer_reviews.author: Sharding

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for gym class
customer_reviews.text: My daughter needed a lock for her gym locker that she could easily remember the combination. This was the perfect combination because she could choose the word! It was very easy to program and was approved by the school. Great price and super quick shipping!
customer_reviews.author: Rosie P

product_meta.title: Master Lock 1535DWD Locker Lock Set Your Own Word Combination Padlock, 1 Pack, Assorted Colors
product_meta.description: Style:Word ComboThe Master Lock 1535DWD Set Your Own Word Combination Padlock features a 1-1/2in (38mm) wide metal body for strength and durability. The 1/4in (6mm) diameter shackle is 15/16in (23mm) long and made of hardened steel, offering extra resistance to cutting and sawing. The dial grip points provide accurate dialing and keyless convenience. The limited lifetime warranty provides peace of mind from a brand you know and can trust.
feature_bullets: Indoor padlock is best used as a school locker lock and gym lock, providing protection and security from theft
Set your own four letter word combination lock for easy combination recall; dials not interchangeable
Combo lock is constructed with a metal body, hardened steel shackle, and anti-shim locking mechanism for strength and security
1-1/2 in. (38 mm) wide lock body; 1/4 in. (6 mm) diameter with 15/16 in. (24 mm) length, 11/16 in. (17 mm) width
Word lock is available in black, blue, light blue, and pink (color randomly selected at time of shipment)

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.5 out of 5 stars3,636 ratings4.5 out of 5 stars
specifications.Domestic Shipping: Item can be shipped within U.S.
